results.title: Schools march on!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Emphasizes that the public eduction system has been a vital factor in the development of America even though there are many inadequacies in schools of rural communities. Shows how Woodford Country Illinois, successfully solved school problems through proper zooming and consolidation. From the “March of time forum film” series.

results.title: Modern surgery
results.creator_credit: March of Time, Inc. and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description: Discusses the resources and techniques of the modern hospital. Follows the case history of Mrs Conrad whose urgent need of an operation was a cause of consternation and fear. She receives advice and assurance from her family physician, enters hospital and finds herself in skilled hands.

results.title: Portugal
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
A general picture of the Republic of Portugal. Presents Portugal as an example of Catholic social and economic policy. Shows the corporate organization of its society, under dictator Salazar. Gives glimpses of Portugal’s chief exports (Port wine, cork) and its fishing and farming - the greater part of the economy. Shows the education system, which is geared to social stability and respect for the past.

results.title: Golden Twenties
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
A chronicle of America’s Jazz Age based on a study of the 1920’s by Frederick Lewis Allen and Samuel Wood Bryant. Over 150 famous people appear, including the Prince of Wales, H.G. Wells, Thomas Edison, Woodrow Wilson, Charles Lindbergh and Al Capone. Famous sporting personalities and entertainers are presented including excerpts from feature films of the era starring Rudolp Valentino, Al Jolson and Greta Garbo among others. Edited by Leo Zochling.

results.title: Upbeat in music
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Produced during World War II, this film illustrates the special organisation and arrangments made to provide adequate musical entertainment for troops, both at home and abroad. One particular section deals with the successful fight by the American Federation of Musicians led by James C. Petrillo, to have (in part) royalties paid to a union unemployment fund. Includes such performers as Marian Anderson, George Gershwin, Benny Goodman, Mischa Elman, Serge Koussevitsky, Glenn Miller, Art Tatum, Duke Ellington and Perry Como.

results.title: Life with junior
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
A typical day in the life of a ten-year-old, presenting such common problems as the acceptance of a new brother and the refusal to eat. Emphasises the anxieties of parents over guiding their children in today’s world, and explains ways in which to cope with behaviour problems.

results.title: Nobody's children
results.creator_credit: Forum Films and March of Time, Inc.
results.brief_description: Beginning with the statement that, in the United States, one couple in seven is childless, this film illustrates the demand for children for adoption, describes the procedures followed and shows that the necessary strictness of these has led to one of America’s most pressing social evils - the “black market” in babies.

results.title: The Family: an approach to peace
results.brief_description: Shows that the only way to peace is in the understanding of other peoples, and contrasts the popular conception of foreign lands with life as it actually is around the globe. Through scenes of everyday family life everywhere, describes the similarity of the fears and aspirations of all people.

results.title: Ground rules
results.creator_credit: Barry Pierce, Anne Whitehead and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Maps and Map Reading”.
An introductory segment that sets out to establish a broad understanding of the use of and need for maps and map reading skills. Three situations are illustrated: an ambulance attending an accident, a car rally navigator planning his route, and two tourists who are hopelessly lost on a back road.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Pierce, Anne Whitehead and Tasmanian Film Corporation
